intro: Bonnetia racemosa, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Bonnetia racemosa thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate and soil conditions of Hawaii.
